017package org.apache.juneau.reflect;
018
019import static org.apache.juneau.common.utils.Utils.*;
020import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ConsumerUtils.*;
021
022import java.beans.*;
023import java.lang.annotation.*;
024import java.lang.reflect.*;
025import java.util.*;
026import java.util.function.*;
027
028import org.apache.juneau.*;
029import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
030
031/**
032 * Lightweight utility class for introspecting information about a method.
033 *
034 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
035 * </ul>
036 */
037@FluentSetters
038public class MethodInfo extends ExecutableInfo implements Comparable<MethodInfo> {
039
040   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
041   // Static
042   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
043
044   /**
045    * Convenience method for instantiating a {@link MethodInfo};
046    *
047    * @param declaringClass The class that declares this method.
048    * @param m The method being wrapped.
049    * @return A new {@link MethodInfo} object, or <jk>null</jk> if the method was null;
050    */
051   public static MethodInfo of(ClassInfo declaringClass, Method m) {
052      if (m == null)
053         return null;
054      return declaringClass.getMethodInfo(m);
055   }
056
057   /**
058    * Convenience method for instantiating a {@link MethodInfo};
059    *
060    * @param declaringClass The class that declares this method.
061    * @param m The method being wrapped.
062    * @return A new {@link MethodInfo} object, or <jk>null</jk> if the method was null;
063    */
064   public static MethodInfo of(Class<?> declaringClass, Method m) {
065      if (m == null)
066         return null;
067      return ClassInfo.of(declaringClass).getMethodInfo(m);
068   }
069
070   /**
071    * Convenience method for instantiating a {@link MethodInfo};
072    *
073    * @param m The method being wrapped.
074    * @return A new {@link MethodInfo} object, or <jk>null</jk> if the method was null;
075    */
076   public static MethodInfo of(Method m) {
077      if (m == null)
078         return null;
079      return ClassInfo.of(m.getDeclaringClass()).getMethodInfo(m);
080   }
081
082   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
083   // Instance
084   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
085
086   private final Method m;
087   private volatile ClassInfo returnType;
088   private volatile MethodInfo[] matching;
089
090   /**
091    * Constructor.
092    *
093    * @param declaringClass The class that declares this method.
094    * @param m The method being wrapped.
095    */
096   protected MethodInfo(ClassInfo declaringClass, Method m) {
097      super(declaringClass, m);
098      this.m = m;
099   }
100
101   /**
102    * Returns the wrapped method.
103    *
104    * @return The wrapped method.
105    */
106   public Method inner() {
107      return m;
108   }
109
110   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
111   // Matching methods.
112   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
113
114   /**
115    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this constructor can accept the specified arguments in the specified order.
116    *
117    * @param args The arguments to check.
118    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this constructor can accept the specified arguments in the specified order.
119    */
120   public boolean canAccept(Object...args) {
121      Class<?>[] pt = m.getParameterTypes();
122      if (pt.length != args.length)
123         return false;
124      for (int i = 0; i < pt.length; i++)
125         if (! pt[i].isInstance(args[i]))
126            return false;
127      return true;
128   }
129
130   /**
131    * Returns the number of matching arguments for this method.
132    *
133    * @param args The arguments to check.
134    * @return the number of matching arguments for this method.
135    */
136   public int canAcceptFuzzy(Object...args) {
137      int matches = 0;
138      outer: for (ClassInfo pi : _getParameterTypes()) {
139         for (Object a : args) {
140            if (pi.canAcceptArg(a)) {
141               matches++;
142               continue outer;
143            }
144         }
145         return -1;
146      }
147      return matches;
148   }
149
150   /**
151    * Performs an action on all matching declared methods with the same name and arguments on all superclasses and interfaces.
152    *
153    * <p>
154    * Methods are accessed from child-to-parent order.
155    *
156    * @param filter A predicate to apply to the entries to determine if action should be performed.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
157    * @param action An action to perform on the entry.
158    * @return This object.
159    */
160   public MethodInfo forEachMatching(Predicate<MethodInfo> filter, Consumer<MethodInfo> action) {
161      for (MethodInfo m : _getMatching())
162         consume(filter, action, m);
163      return this;
164   }
165
166   /**
167    * Performs an action on all matching declared methods with the same name and arguments on all superclasses and interfaces.
168    *
169    * <p>
170    * Methods are accessed from parent-to-child order.
171    *
172    * @param filter A predicate to apply to the entries to determine if action should be performed.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
173    * @param action An action to perform on the entry.
174    * @return This object.
175    */
176   public MethodInfo forEachMatchingParentFirst(Predicate<MethodInfo> filter, Consumer<MethodInfo> action) {
177      MethodInfo[] m = _getMatching();
178      for (int i = m.length-1; i >= 0; i--)
179         consume(filter, action, m[i]);
180      return this;
181   }
182
183   private static List<MethodInfo> findMatching(List<MethodInfo> l, MethodInfo m, ClassInfo c) {
184      for (MethodInfo m2 : c._getDeclaredMethods())
185         if (m.hasName(m2.getName()) && Arrays.equals(m._getParameterTypes(), m2._getParameterTypes()))
186            l.add(m2);
187      ClassInfo pc = c.getSuperclass();
188      if (pc != null)
189         findMatching(l, m, pc);
190      for (ClassInfo ic : c._getDeclaredInterfaces())
191         findMatching(l, m, ic);
192      return l;
193   }
194
195   private MethodInfo findMatchingOnClass(ClassInfo c) {
196      for (MethodInfo m2 : c._getDeclaredMethods())
197         if (hasName(m2.getName()) && Arrays.equals(_getParameterTypes(), m2._getParameterTypes()))
198            return m2;
199      return null;
200   }
201
202   MethodInfo[] _getMatching() {
203      if (matching == null) {
204         synchronized(this) {
205            List<MethodInfo> l = findMatching(list(), this, getDeclaringClass());
206            matching = l.toArray(new MethodInfo[l.size()]);
207         }
208      }
209      return matching;
210   }
211
212   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
213   // Annotations
214   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
215
216   /**
217    * Finds the annotation of the specified type defined on this method.
218    *
219    * <p>
220    * If this is a method and the annotation cannot be found on the immediate method, searches methods with the same
221    * signature on the parent classes or interfaces.
222    * <br>The search is performed in child-to-parent order.
223    *
224    * @param <A> The annotation type to look for.
225    * @param type The annotation to look for.
226    * @return The annotation if found, or <jk>null</jk> if not.
227    */
228   public <A extends Annotation> A getAnnotation(Class<A> type) {
229      return getAnnotation(AnnotationProvider.DEFAULT, type);
230   }
231
232   /**
233    * Finds the annotation of the specified type defined on this method.
234    *
235    * <p>
236    * Searches all methods with the same signature on the parent classes or interfaces
237    * and the return type on the method.
238    *
239    * @param <A> The annotation type to look for.
240    * @param annotationProvider The annotation provider.
241    * @param type The annotation to look for.
242    * @return The first annotation found, or <jk>null</jk> if it doesn't exist.
243    */
244   public <A extends Annotation> A getAnnotation(AnnotationProvider annotationProvider, Class<A> type) {
245      if (type == null)
246         return null;
247      Value<A> t = Value.empty();
248      for (MethodInfo m2 : _getMatching()) {
249         annotationProvider.forEachAnnotation(type, m2.inner(), x -> true, x -> t.set(x));
250         if (t.isPresent())
251            return t.get();
252      }
253      return null;
254   }
255
256   /**
257    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if the specified annotation is present on this method.
258    *
259    * @param <A> The annotation type to look for.
260    * @param type The annotation to look for.
261    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the specified annotation is present on this method.
262    */
263   public <A extends Annotation> boolean hasAnnotation(Class<A> type) {
264      return hasAnnotation(AnnotationProvider.DEFAULT, type);
265   }
266
267   /**
268    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if the specified annotation is present on this method.
269    *
270    * @param <A> The annotation type to look for.
271    * @param annotationProvider The annotation provider.
272    * @param type The annotation to look for.
273    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the specified annotation is present on this method.
274    */
275   public <A extends Annotation> boolean hasAnnotation(AnnotationProvider annotationProvider, Class<A> type) {
276      for (MethodInfo m2 : _getMatching())
277         if (annotationProvider.firstAnnotation(type, m2.inner(), x -> true) != null)
278            return true;
279      return false;
280   }
281
282   /**
283    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if the specified annotation is not present on this method.
284    *
285    * @param <A> The annotation type to look for.
286    * @param annotationProvider The annotation provider.
287    * @param type The annotation to look for.
288    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the specified annotation is not present on this method.
289    */
290   public <A extends Annotation> boolean hasNoAnnotation(AnnotationProvider annotationProvider, Class<A> type) {
291      return ! hasAnnotation(annotationProvider, type);
292   }
293
294   /**
295    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if the specified annotation is not present on this method.
296    *
297    * @param <A> The annotation type to look for.
298    * @param type The annotation to look for.
299    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the specified annotation is not present on this method.
300    */
301   public <A extends Annotation> boolean hasNoAnnotation(Class<A> type) {
302      return getAnnotation(type) == null;
303   }
304
305   /**
306    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if at least one of the specified annotation is present on this method.
307    *
308    * @param types The annotation to look for.
309    * @return <jk>true</jk> if at least one of the specified annotation is present on this method.
310    */
311   @SafeVarargs
312   public final boolean hasAnyAnnotations(Class<? extends Annotation>...types) {
313      for (Class<? extends Annotation> a : types)
314         if (hasAnnotation(a))
315            return true;
316      return false;
317   }
318
319   /**
320    * Performs an action on all matching annotations defined on this method.
321    *
322    * <p>
323    * Searches all methods with the same signature on the parent classes or interfaces
324    * and the return type on the method.
325    * <br>Results are parent-to-child ordered.
326    *
327    * @param <A> The annotation type to look for.
328    * @param type The annotation to look for.
329    * @param filter A predicate to apply to the entries to determine if action should be performed.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
330    * @param action An action to perform on the entry.
331    * @return This object.
332    */
333   public <A extends Annotation> MethodInfo forEachAnnotation(Class<A> type, Predicate<A> filter, Consumer<A> action) {
334      return forEachAnnotation(AnnotationProvider.DEFAULT, type, filter, action);
335   }
336
337   /**
338    * Performs an action on all matching annotations defined on this method.
339    *
340    * <p>
341    * Searches all methods with the same signature on the parent classes or interfaces
342    * and the return type on the method.
343    * <br>Results are parent-to-child ordered.
344    *
345    * @param <A> The annotation type to look for.
346    * @param annotationProvider The annotation provider.
347    * @param type The annotation type.
348    * @param filter A predicate to apply to the entries to determine if action should be performed.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
349    * @param action An action to perform on the entry.
350    * @return This object.
351    */
352   public <A extends Annotation> MethodInfo forEachAnnotation(AnnotationProvider annotationProvider, Class<A> type, Predicate<A> filter, Consumer<A> action) {
353      declaringClass.forEachAnnotation(annotationProvider, type, filter, action);
354      MethodInfo[] m = _getMatching();
355      for (int i = m.length-1; i >= 0; i--)
356         for (Annotation a2 : m[i]._getDeclaredAnnotations())
357            consume(type, filter, action, a2);
358      getReturnType().unwrap(Value.class,Optional.class).forEachAnnotation(annotationProvider, type, filter, action);
359      return this;
360   }
361
362   /**
363    * Returns the first annotation in the specified list on this method.
364    *
365    * @param types The annotations to look for.
366    * @return The first matching annotation.
367    */
368   @SafeVarargs
369   public final Annotation getAnyAnnotation(Class<? extends Annotation>...types) {
370      for (Class<? extends Annotation> cc : types) {
371         Annotation a = getAnnotation(cc);
372         if (a != null)
373            return a;
374      }
375      return null;
376   }
377
378   /**
379    * Constructs an {@link AnnotationList} of all annotations found on this method.
380    *
381    * <p>
382    * Annotations are appended in the following orders:
383    * <ol>
384    *    <li>On the package of this class.
385    *    <li>On interfaces ordered parent-to-child.
386    *    <li>On parent classes ordered parent-to-child.
387    *    <li>On this class.
388    *    <li>On this method and matching methods ordered parent-to-child.
389    * </ol>
390    *
391    * @return A new {@link AnnotationList} object on every call.
392    */
393   public AnnotationList getAnnotationList() {
394      return getAnnotationList(x -> true);
395   }
396
397   /**
398    * Constructs an {@link AnnotationList} of all matching annotations found on this method.
399    *
400    * <p>
401    * Annotations are appended in the following orders:
402    * <ol>
403    *    <li>On the package of this class.
404    *    <li>On interfaces ordered parent-to-child.
405    *    <li>On parent classes ordered parent-to-child.
406    *    <li>On this class.
407    *    <li>On this method and matching methods ordered parent-to-child.
408    * </ol>
409    *
410    * @param filter A predicate to apply to the entries to determine if value should be added.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
411    * @return A new {@link AnnotationList} object on every call.
412    */
413   public AnnotationList getAnnotationList(Predicate<AnnotationInfo<?>> filter) {
414      AnnotationList al = new AnnotationList();
415      forEachAnnotationInfo(filter, x -> al.add(x));
416      return al;
417   }
418
419   /**
420    * Same as {@link #getAnnotationList(Predicate)} except only returns annotations defined on methods.
421    *
422    * @param filter A predicate to apply to the entries to determine if value should be added.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
423    * @return A new {@link AnnotationList} object on every call.
424    */
425   public AnnotationList getAnnotationListMethodOnly(Predicate<AnnotationInfo<?>> filter) {
426      AnnotationList al = new AnnotationList();
427      forEachAnnotationInfoMethodOnly(filter, x -> al.add(x));
428      return al;
429   }
430
431   /**
432    * Perform an action on all matching annotations on this method.
433    *
434    * @param filter A predicate to apply to the entries to determine if action should be performed.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
435    * @param action An action to perform on the entry.
436    * @return This object.
437    */
438   public MethodInfo forEachAnnotationInfo(Predicate<AnnotationInfo<?>> filter, Consumer<AnnotationInfo<?>> action) {
439      ClassInfo c = this.declaringClass;
440      forEachDeclaredAnnotationInfo(c.getPackage(), filter, action);
441      ClassInfo[] interfaces = c._getInterfaces();
442      for (int i = interfaces.length-1; i >= 0; i--) {
443         forEachDeclaredAnnotationInfo(interfaces[i], filter, action);
444         forEachDeclaredMethodAnnotationInfo(interfaces[i], filter, action);
445      }
446      ClassInfo[] parents = c._getParents();
447      for (int i = parents.length-1; i >= 0; i--) {
448         forEachDeclaredAnnotationInfo(parents[i], filter, action);
449         forEachDeclaredMethodAnnotationInfo(parents[i], filter, action);
450      }
451      return this;
452   }
453
454   private void forEachAnnotationInfoMethodOnly(Predicate<AnnotationInfo<?>> filter, Consumer<AnnotationInfo<?>> action) {
455      ClassInfo c = this.declaringClass;
456      ClassInfo[] interfaces = c._getInterfaces();
457      for (int i = interfaces.length-1; i >= 0; i--)
458         forEachDeclaredMethodAnnotationInfo(interfaces[i], filter, action);
459      ClassInfo[] parents = c._getParents();
460      for (int i = parents.length-1; i >= 0; i--)
461         forEachDeclaredMethodAnnotationInfo(parents[i], filter, action);
462   }
463
464   private void forEachDeclaredAnnotationInfo(Package p, Predicate<AnnotationInfo<?>> filter, Consumer<AnnotationInfo<?>> action) {
465      if (p != null)
466         for (Annotation a : p.getDeclaredAnnotations())
467            AnnotationInfo.of(p, a).accept(filter, action);
468   }
469
470   private void forEachDeclaredAnnotationInfo(ClassInfo ci, Predicate<AnnotationInfo<?>> filter, Consumer<AnnotationInfo<?>> action) {
471      if (ci != null)
472         for (Annotation a : ci._getDeclaredAnnotations())
473            AnnotationInfo.of(ci, a).accept(filter, action);
474   }
475
476   private void forEachDeclaredMethodAnnotationInfo(ClassInfo ci, Predicate<AnnotationInfo<?>> filter, Consumer<AnnotationInfo<?>> action) {
477      MethodInfo m = findMatchingOnClass(ci);
478      if (m != null)
479         for (Annotation a : m._getDeclaredAnnotations())
480            AnnotationInfo.of(m, a).accept(filter, action);
481   }
482
483   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
484   // Return type.
485   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
486
487   /**
488    * Returns the generic return type of this method as a {@link ClassInfo} object.
489    *
490    * @return The generic return type of this method.
491    */
492   public ClassInfo getReturnType() {
493      if (returnType == null) {
494         synchronized(this) {
495            returnType = ClassInfo.of(m.getReturnType(), m.getGenericReturnType());
496         }
497      }
498      return returnType;
499   }
500
501   /**
502    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this method has this return type.
503    *
504    * @param c The return type to test for.
505    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this method has this return type.
506    */
507   public boolean hasReturnType(Class<?> c) {
508      return m.getReturnType() == c;
509   }
510
511   /**
512    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this method has this return type.
513    *
514    * @param ci The return type to test for.
515    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this method has this return type.
516    */
517   public boolean hasReturnType(ClassInfo ci) {
518      return hasReturnType(ci.inner());
519   }
520
521   /**
522    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this method has this parent return type.
523    *
524    * @param c The return type to test for.
525    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this method has this parent return type.
526    */
527   public boolean hasReturnTypeParent(Class<?> c) {
528      return ClassInfo.of(c).isParentOf(m.getReturnType());
529   }
530
531   /**
532    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this method has this parent return type.
533    *
534    * @param ci The return type to test for.
535    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this method has this parent return type.
536    */
537   public boolean hasReturnTypeParent(ClassInfo ci) {
538      return hasReturnTypeParent(ci.inner());
539   }
540
541   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
542   // Other methods
543   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
544
545   /**
546    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this object passes the specified predicate test.
547    *
548    * @param test The test to perform.
549    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this object passes the specified predicate test.
550    */
551   public boolean matches(Predicate<MethodInfo> test) {
552      return test(test, this);
553   }
554
555   /**
556    * Performs an action on this object if the specified predicate test passes.
557    *
558    * @param test A test to apply to determine if action should be executed.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
559    * @param action An action to perform on this object.
560    * @return This object.
561    */
562   public MethodInfo accept(Predicate<MethodInfo> test, Consumer<MethodInfo> action) {
563      if (matches(test))
564         action.accept(this);
565      return this;
566   }
567
568   /**
569    * Shortcut for calling the invoke method on the underlying method.
570    *
571    * @param <T> The method return type.
572    * @param obj the object the underlying method is invoked from.
573    * @param args the arguments used for the method call
574    * @return The object returned from the method.
575    * @throws ExecutableException Exception occurred on invoked constructor/method/field.
576    */
577   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
578   public <T> T invoke(Object obj, Object...args) throws ExecutableException {
579      try {
580         return (T)m.invoke(obj, args);
581      } catch (IllegalAccessException e) {
582         throw new ExecutableException(e);
583      } catch (InvocationTargetException e) {
584         throw new ExecutableException(e.getTargetException());
585      }
586   }
587
588   /**
589    * Invokes the specified method using fuzzy-arg matching.
590    *
591    * <p>
592    * Arguments will be matched to the parameters based on the parameter types.
593    * <br>Arguments can be in any order.
594    * <br>Extra arguments will be ignored.
595    * <br>Missing arguments will be left <jk>null</jk>.
596    *
597    * <p>
598    * Note that this only works for methods that have distinguishable argument types.
599    * <br>It's not going to work on methods with generic argument types like <c>Object</c>
600    *
601    * @param pojo
602    *    The POJO the method is being called on.
603    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> for static methods.
604    * @param args
605    *    The arguments to pass to the method.
606    * @return
607    *    The results of the method invocation.
608    * @throws ExecutableException Exception occurred on invoked constructor/method/field.
609    */
610   public Object invokeFuzzy(Object pojo, Object...args) throws ExecutableException {
611      try {
612         return m.invoke(pojo, ClassUtils.getMatchingArgs(m.getParameterTypes(), args));
613      } catch (IllegalAccessException | InvocationTargetException e) {
614         throw new ExecutableException(e);
615      }
616   }
617
618   /**
619    * Returns the signature of this method.
620    *
621    * <p>
622    * For no-arg methods, the signature will be a simple string such as <js>"toString"</js>.
623    * For methods with one or more args, the arguments will be fully-qualified class names (e.g.
624    * <js>"append(java.util.StringBuilder,boolean)"</js>)
625    *
626    * @return The methods signature.
627    */
628   public String getSignature() {
629      StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder(128);
630      sb.append(m.getName());
631      Class<?>[] pt = _getRawParamTypes();
632      if (pt.length > 0) {
633         sb.append('(');
634         List<ParamInfo> mpi = getParams();
635         for (int i = 0; i < pt.length; i++) {
636            if (i > 0)
637               sb.append(',');
638            mpi.get(i).getParameterType().appendFullName(sb);
639         }
640         sb.append(')');
641      }
642      return sb.toString();
643   }
644
645   /**
646    * Returns the bean property name if this is a getter or setter.
647    *
648    * @return The bean property name, or <jk>null</jk> if this isn't a getter or setter.
649    */
650   public String getPropertyName() {
651      String n = m.getName();
652      if ((n.startsWith("get") || n.startsWith("set")) && n.length() > 3)
653         return Introspector.decapitalize(n.substring(3));
654      if (n.startsWith("is") && n.length() > 2)
655         return Introspector.decapitalize(n.substring(2));
656      return n;
657   }
658
659   /**
660    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if the parameters on the method only consist of the types specified in the list.
661    *
662    * <h5 class='figure'>Example:</h5>
663    * <p class='bjava'>
664    *
665    *    <jc>// Example method:</jc>
666    *    <jk>public void</jk> foo(String <jv>bar</jv>, Integer <jv>baz</jv>);
667    *
668    *    argsOnlyOfType(<jv>fooMethod</jv>, String.<jk>class</jk>, Integer.<jk>class</jk>);  <jc>// True.</jc>
669    *    argsOnlyOfType(<jv>fooMethod</jv>, String.<jk>class</jk>, Integer.<jk>class</jk>, Map.<jk>class</jk>);  <jc>// True.</jc>
670    *    argsOnlyOfType(<jv>fooMethod</jv>, String.<jk>class</jk>);  <jc>// False.</jc>
671    * </p>
672    *
673    * @param args The valid class types (exact) for the arguments.
674    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the method parameters only consist of the types specified in the list.
675    */
676   public boolean argsOnlyOfType(Class<?>...args) {
677      for (Class<?> c1 : _getRawParamTypes()) {
678         boolean foundMatch = false;
679         for (Class<?> c2 : args)
680            if (c1 == c2)
681               foundMatch = true;
682         if (! foundMatch)
683            return false;
684      }
685      return true;
686   }
687
688   /**
689    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this method has at least the specified parameters.
690    *
691    * <p>
692    * Method may or may not have additional parameters besides those specified.
693    *
694    * @param requiredParams The parameter types to check for.
695    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this method has at least the specified parameters.
696    */
697   public boolean hasAllArgs(Class<?>...requiredParams) {
698      List<Class<?>> rawParamTypes = getRawParamTypes();
699
700      for (Class<?> c : requiredParams)
701         if (! rawParamTypes.contains(c))
702            return false;
703
704      return true;
705   }
706
707   /**
708    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this method has the specified parameter.
709    *
710    * <p>
711    * Method may or may not have additional parameters besides the one specified.
712    *
713    * @param requiredParam The parameter type to check for.
714    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this method has at least the specified parameter.
715    */
716   public boolean hasArg(Class<?> requiredParam) {
717      return hasAllArgs(requiredParam);
718   }
719
720   /**
721    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this method is a bridge method.
722    *
723    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this method is a bridge method.
724    */
725   public boolean isBridge() {
726      return m.isBridge();
727   }
728
729   /**
730    * Returns the name of this method.
731    *
732    * @return The name of this method
733    */
734   public String getName() {
735      return m.getName();
736   }
737
738   @Override
739   public int compareTo(MethodInfo o) {
740      int i = getSimpleName().compareTo(o.getSimpleName());
741      if (i == 0) {
742         i = _getRawParamTypes().length - o._getRawParamTypes().length;
743         if (i == 0) {
744            for (int j = 0; j < _getRawParamTypes().length && i == 0; j++) {
745               i = _getRawParamTypes()[j].getName().compareTo(o._getRawParamTypes()[j].getName());
746            }
747         }
748      }
749      return i;
750   }

755   public MethodInfo accessible() {
756      super.accessible();
757      return this;
758   }
